alert.note: Alert for Clark (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 9:01AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern Nevada, including the following county, Clark. * WHEN...Until 1015 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams, normally dry washes and flood channels. Ponding of water in urban or other areas will continue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 852 AM PDT, The Las Vegas and Flamingo Washes on the east side of the Las Vegas Valley are indicating more substantial rises of 5 to 8 feet between Vegas Valley Drive and East Sahara Ave. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Las Vegas, Henderson, North Las Vegas, Boulder City, The Strip, Downtown Las Vegas, Paradise, Spring Valley, Enterprise, Green Valley, East Las Vegas, Southern Highlands, Sam Boyd Stadium, Mountains Edge, Summerlin, Nellis AFB, Aliante, Lone Mountain, Anthem and Centennial Hills. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
